runs.comm: full length ball around off stump, a nervy forward push comes off an inside edge past backward square and runs out for two runs as deep square runs to his right
shorter and pulled off the toe of the bat on the bounce to mid on, just short of him
flicked through square leg and the outfield is pretty slow so just a couple again to the backward square rope

slower ball, chipped into the leg side off the toe of the bat, and a superb diving catch going back from mid on. Brilliant take, diving backwards at full length and claiming it with two hands. The slower ball deceived Levi who was backing away trying to give himself room, ended up being too soon with the shot and chipped it up
length ball just outside off, crashed over cover point for four, up and over with good timing from off stump, moving slightly to leg
full and carved out to the sweeper
length ball outside off, smashed with great timing again over extra cover, beautifully played
fast and full onto off stump, turned to deep midwicket for just a single
full toss on the off stump but just calmly blocked to point, there's a fumble so they scramble through for a single

half volley on the off stump, Amla opens the front leg and smashed it over extra cover again, gorgeous strike once more, the timing is absolutely to perfection, has this guy scored any runs recently? Looks in good form
full toss down the leg side as Amla stepped to the off side to try and beat short long leg
step to the leg side and then back to the stumps, length ball outside off, a play and miss, no need for that, stand still and whack it
another step to leg, Malinga follows him with a quick yorker length ball that's dug out to short long leg, well bowled that
down the wicket and slapping a length ball down to long off
leg stump, turned to leg where everyone is out on the boundary so they take two
tossed up outside off, down the wicket and just keeps it out back to the bowler on the stretch
reached for again but pushed towards deep point, more great running
waited for and pushed out to the cover sweeper

down the wicket, now this is agricultural, misses completely and Sangakkara has the bails off before Amla can even say, "oh dear", I think this 7-7 stuff has gone to Amla's head, just play properly! But he's gone swinging, missing totally a ball that was angled in and beat him as he backed away and it went past leg stump
back of a length around off stump, blocked into the covers
back of a length outside off, cut wide of deep cover so they take two easily
similar line, pulled straight to the fielder who shies at the non-striker's end and misses, a hit and he was gone
swing and a miss to a back of a length ball outside off
outside off and timed nicely off the back foot, a great diving save from deep cover saves four but great running again means they take a third on the arm
step to leg, followed him on back of a length, pulled towards square leg not timed
reverse sweep and gets it over point, well timed and it runs out to the boundary past the sweeper
goes on side this time to a fuller ball, played to long on
heaved down to long leg again
more length this time and heaved off the back foot wide of long on for the first maximum, great strike
full and driven to extra cover, a sliding save
lifted down to long on and more aggressive running brings a couple
full ball swinging away from off stump, swings too much
short ball and a wonderful strike, smashed over midwicket, that has gone a long long way back, huge strike, stepped across the off stump a little and then bang over the rope
full ball on off stump, tries to go off side and just gets it over extra cover
length this time on off stump, a swing gets a wild edge to third man and Kulasekara does really well to save four with a left hand
over extra cover again, and again doesn't get all of it, just over the fielders
full outside off again, reaching for it slightly, slapped over extra cover, not timed though, but they run well again
stepped across the stumps, full again, chipped to mid off, didn't time it at all, straight to the fielder
full on off stump, flicked out to the midwicket boundary, again the running is exactly how it needs to be
great yorker and dug back to the bowler
good length again, goes for the paddle sweep, comes off the pad towards square leg
full just outside off, struck down the ground but doesn't clear long off, looked a good strike but it was taken right on the rope
full ball again and this time Duminy pulls off the scoop and it lands very close to the long leg rope, nearly got it all the way, very well played that was
length on off stump and a superb strike straight down the ground carries all the way for six, great connection and it flies over long on
